content.title: Upcoming Presentations
description: Free Law: Resources, Technology & Legal Issues (Past, Present & Future)

Explore free legal research solutions in our webinar on Free Law with Justia CEO Tim Stanley. Discover key resources and delve into legal issues like copyright, privacy, and public access. Tim will trace the history and technology behind organizations offering free legal resources, examining the Free Law movement's evolution since the 1990s. Uncover the impact of litigation and court decisions on this movement, including notable cases like HyperLaw and Public Resource. Tim will also address legal concerns related to AI training with court records and government documents, exploring their implications for legal research and AI. Throughout the webinar, Tim will guide you to the best online sources for free law, covering Federal and US state, educational, and organizational websites. Join us for a cost-effective exploration of the legal landscape!

content.title: Recent Recordings
description: The Addicted Lawyer. How We Got Here. Where We Are Headed.

Substance use disorders in the legal community are a well-known issue that can substantially impair an attorney’s ability to practice law and adhere to professional obligations. In this CLE-accredited webinar, Brian Cuban explores the impacts of mental health and recovery in the legal profession. Please note this program is accredited for one hour of Prevention and Detection Competence MCLE credit in California, one hour of Substance Abuse/Mental Health credit in North Carolina, and one hour of Substance Abuse/Mental Health credit in South Carolina (all levels). It has also been submitted to the Texas Commission on MCLE for review of CLE accreditation status.

content.title: Upcoming Presentations
description: Free Law: Resources, Technology & Legal Issues (Past, Present & Future)

Recent studies have shown that there has been a dramatic increase in impairment due to alcoholism, addiction, and mental health disorders among members of the legal profession. What role does an always-connected society and technology play in this phenomenon? Explore this question in our upcoming webinar led by Brian S. Quinn of Lawyers Concerned for Lawyers of Pennsylvania. Please note this webinar is approved for one hour of California Competence Issues MCLE credit.
